issues: Inconsistent use of bullet points or consistent formatting for project and experience descriptions.
Dates in professional experiences are not fully written (2025 instead of the whole period).
Inconsistent capitalization and punctuation in section titles (e.g., 'COMPÃ‰TENCES' vs. 'Education').
suggestions: Use bullet points or consistent indentation to delineate responsibilities and achievements within each role/project for better readability.
Always include full dates when listing experiences. E.g., July-August 2023, NOT just August 2023
Ensure all section titles have consistent capitalization (e.g., title case or all caps) and punctuation.

strengths: Demonstrates a wide range of technical skills relevant to software development (multiple programming languages, database management, web development).
Includes a variety of projects that showcase practical application of skills (antenna design, system authentication, database management).
Highlights involvement in extracurricular activities and certifications, indicating a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
weaknesses: Lacks specific examples of server-side development experience (Node.js, Django/Spring Boot) directly relevant to the job description.
Does not quantify achievements or demonstrate the impact of projects (e.g., scale of database, performance improvements).
Missing clear evidence of experience with system architecture, scalability, cloud deployment, and API management as required by the job description.
suggestions: Explicitly mention any server-side projects, even if they are small or academic, highlighting the technologies used and the outcomes achieved.
Quantify achievements whenever possible (e.g., 'Improved query performance by X%' or 'Handled Y users in our application').

Tailor the 'Projects' and 'Skills' sections to directly address the key requirements of the server-side developer job description. Highlight experience with databases, system architecture, scaling, and API development.

general.summary: The CV shows promise with a broad range of technical skills and projects. However, it needs to be tailored more specifically to the server-side development job description to highlight relevant experience and demonstrate the impact of projects.
top_priorities: Tailor the CV to directly address the key requirements of the server-side developer job description by adding keywords, relevant projects and quantifying achievements.
Provide specific examples of server-side development experience using the technologies mentioned in the job description.
Improve the formatting for enhanced readability and consistency.
